00031   const char *help_text_contents[] = {
00032     "",
00033     "mkdir ............. Creates a directory in Hyperspace",
00034     "delete ............ Delete file/directory",
00035     "open .............. Open a file/directory",
00036     "create ............ Create a file",
00037     "close ............. Close previously opened file/directory",
00038     "attrset ........... Set an attribute (key/value pair) for a file/directory",
00039     "attrget ........... Retrieve an attribute for a file/directory",
00040     "attrexists ........ Check if a particular attribute is set for a file/directory",
00041     "attrlist .......... Retrieve all attributes (keys only) for a file/directory",
00042     "attrdel ........... Delete an attribure for a file/directory",
00043     "exists ............ Check if a file/directory exists",
00044     "readdir ........... List the contents of a previously opened directory",
00045     "lock .............. Lock access to a file/directory",
00046     "trylock ........... Check whether a lock on file/directory would succeed",
00047     "release ........... Release previously acquired lock",
00048     "getseq ............ Get a lock sequencer for a file/directory",
00049     "echo .............. Echo user input",
00050     "",
00051     "Statements must be terminated with ';' to execute.  For more information on",
00052     "a specific statement, type 'help <statement>', where <statement> is one from",
00053     "the preceeding list.",
00054     "",
00055     0
00056   };

00071     "open <fname> flags=[READ|WRITE|LOCK|CREATE|EXCL|TEMP|LOCK_SHARED|LOCK_EXCLUSIVE] [event-mask=<mask>]",
00072     "  This command issues an OPEN request to Hyperspace.  The optional",
00073     "  parameter event-mask may take a value that is the combination of",
00074     "  the following strings:",
00075     "    ATTR_SET|ATTR_DEL|CHILD_NODE_ADDED|CHILD_NODE_REMOVED|LOCK_ACQUIRED|LOCK_RELEASED",

00079   const char *help_create[] = {
00080     "create <fname> flags=[READ|WRITE|LOCK|TEMP|LOCK_SHARED|LOCK_EXCLUSIVE] [OPTIONS]",
00081     "OPTIONS:",
00082     "  attr:<name>=<value>  This can be used to specify extended attributes that should",
00083     "                       get created atomically when the file is created",
00084     "  event-mask=<mask>  This indicates which events should be delivered on this handle.",
00085     "                     The <mask> value can take any combination of the following:",
00086     "                     ATTR_SET|ATTR_DEL|LOCK_ACQUIRED|LOCK_RELEASED",

00166   typedef Hypertable::hash_map<std::string, const char **>  HelpTextMap;
00167 
00168   HelpTextMap &build_help_text_map() {
00169     HelpTextMap *map = new HelpTextMap();
00170     (*map)[""] = help_text_contents;
00171     (*map)["mkdir"] = help_mkdir;
00172     (*map)["delete"] = help_delete;
00173     (*map)["open"] = help_open;
00174     (*map)["create"] = help_create;
00175     (*map)["close"] = help_close;
00176     (*map)["attrset"] = help_attrset;
00177     (*map)["attrget"] = help_attrget;
00178     (*map)["attrexists"] = help_attrexists;
00179     (*map)["attrlist"] = help_attrlist;
00180     (*map)["attrdel"] = help_attrdel;
00181     (*map)["exists"] = help_exists;
00182     (*map)["readdir"] = help_readdir;
00183     (*map)["lock"] = help_lock;
00184     (*map)["trylock"] = help_trylock;
00185     (*map)["release"] = help_release;
00186     (*map)["getseq"] = help_getsequencer;
00187     return *map;
00188   }
00189 
00190   HelpTextMap &text_map = build_help_text_map();
00191 }
00192 
00193 
00194 const char **HsHelpText::get(const std::string &subject) {
00195   HelpTextMap::const_iterator iter = text_map.find(subject);
00196   if (iter == text_map.end())
00197     return 0;
00198   return (*iter).second;
00199 }
